title: Book Editor & Publishing/Marketing Assistant
job_overview:
Job Title: Book Editor & Publishing/Marketing Assistant

THIS IS A TEMPORARY JOB with availability to start immediately. It pays $2 an hour and should be about a month long project.

Job Type: Contract / Part-Time / Freelance (customizable)

Location: Remote

Overview:
We are seeking a detail-oriented, creative, and organized individual to support the final stages of preparing a nonfiction manuscript for publication. This role involves copy editing, proofreading, publishing assistance, and book marketing support. The ideal candidate has experience in editing long-form content, understands self-publishing processes (Amazon KDP, IngramSpark, etc.), and can assist with marketing and promotional planning for a successful book launch.

Key Responsibilities
Copy Editing & Proofreading

Edit for grammar, clarity, consistency, tone, and flow

Flag inconsistencies in structure, formatting, or citations

Ensure alignment with intended audience and voice

Deliver final clean manuscript ready for layout and publishing

Publishing Assistance

Assist with manuscript formatting for print and eBook

Guide or handle uploading to Amazon KDP, IngramSpark, or other platforms

Support ISBN registration, copyright, and pricing setup

Coordinate with designers for cover and interior layout

Marketing & Promotion

Help craft book description, back cover copy, and author bio

Assist in developing a launch plan (social media, email, events, media outreach)

Research promotional opportunities (podcasts, guest blogs, launch partners)

Support setup of author platforms (website, Goodreads, Amazon Author page)

Monitor early reviews, feedback, and marketing results

Qualifications
Proven experience in book editing (nonfiction preferred)

Familiarity with publishing platforms like KDP or IngramSpark

Understanding of book marketing strategies and trends

Excellent written communication and organizational skills

Bonus: Experience with Canva, Mailchimp, Substack, or book PR tools
